comment._content: I am often startled by the clothing that people wore during this time. Moreso than any other time in history.

comment.author: 25441481@N07
comment._content:
The shape and style of the bonnets that the wives and daugthers of the farmers of Europe wore were very particular to each small region, which often as small as one village. 

Bonnets were constructed of embroidery and lace and some assumed quite dramatic shapes and sizes.  The common elements were the head hugging cap itself, a large edging across the front, long tabs that hung down from the cap called lappets, sometimes a ruffled wide edging around the bottom.  These were Sunday best and worn on any occasion requiring one's "best" attire.  

The bonnets were made of whatever was available.  The laces were handmade or machine made (after about 1850).  Sometimes the wearer would make their own lace, sometimes they bought the laces.  Sometimes the laces were recycled pieces from clothing.  Embroidered parts were less likely to be bought.  

Most of the laces used for bonnets didn't change much over time, so that it is very difficult to identify when they were made.
